oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mountain View Nursery program - 1948-12-24 - 5:30 am show [date unconfirmed]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: WSM program sponsored by Mountain View Nursery, starring Wally Fowler with the Georgia Clodhoppers and the Oak Ridge Quartet. Likely originally broadcast December 24, 1948 (unconfirmed, based on mentions that the following day will be Christmas day and a Saturday, and the Oak Ridge Quartet lineup of 1948) at 5:30 am. Personnel include Ernie Keller (announcer), and performers Wally Fowler, Floyd Ethridge, Johnny New, Lon 'Deacon' Freeman, Junior Matthews, and Monroe 'Curley' Blaylock.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wally Fowler; Georgia Clodhoppers; Oak Ridge Quartet
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Theme -- Opening statement (Ernie Keller) -- Opening statement (Wally Fowler) -- The Dearest Friend I Ever Had -- Mountain View Nursery commercial (Ernie Keller) -- Twinkle Little Star (Floyd Ethridge fiddle) -- Wally Fowler introduces Johnny New -- Building My Dreams Around You (Johnny New vocals) -- Wally Fowler introduces the Oak Ridge Quartet -- You Must Have That Pure Religion -- Mountain View Nursery commercial (Ernie Keller) -- Wally Fowler talks -- Red Roses Tied In Blue -- Closing statement (Wally Fowler) -- Theme -- Closing statement (Ernie Keller)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); Keller, Ernie; Fowler, Wally; Georgia Clodhoppers (Musical group); Oak Ridge Quartet; Ethridge, Floyd, 1908-1981; New, Johnny; Freeman, Lon Deacon; Matthews, Junior; Blaylock, Monroe Curley
